segments.text: I glance at the woman in the kitchen and can't help but feel a bit frustrated.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not see what’s happening right in front of her?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That water is pouring out like a waterfall, and she’s blissfully unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is becoming a wet mess, and I fear someone is going to slip and fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are so mischievous; it’s almost charming.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But my heart races when I see the boy teetering on the edge of that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a risky game they’re playing, and I can’t help but feel a sense of disgust at the thought of the mess that’s about to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s eagerness to get a cookie makes her look innocent, yet it’s all so dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish the woman would just turn around and see what’s going on!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s funny how the simple act of baking can turn into such a scene of mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR
